html:
multitude of her strangers shall be like small dust. The multitude, mentioned twice in this verse, refers to the nations that destroyed Jerusalem in the past (including Babylon, Rome, and all others who laid siege against her; 29:3) or who will fight against Jerusalem in the future. These once-mighty nations will suffer the judgments of God and become like the fine dust of the earth.

it shall be at an instant suddenly. Nephi wrote: "Wherefore, as those who have been destroyed have been destroyed speedily; and the multitude of their terrible ones shall be as chaff that passeth away—yea, thus saith the Lord God: It shall be at an instant, suddenly" (2 Ne. 26:18).
